channel.title: briefUpdatesMainNLbusinessAndMarkets
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from briefUpdatesMainNLbusinessAndMarkets, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Why Jack Dorsey Wanted His Company’s Name to Be ‘Boring’
item.description: It might actually be cool to be Square. The company just announced new tools for businesses.

item.title: The Future of Your Office is an Event Space
item.description: These CEOs have found new revenue streams by finding creative ways to open their offices for everything from weddings to meetings.

item.title: OpenAI COO Brad Lightcap on what history teaches us about AI and the enterprise race
item.description: Though much of OpenAI’s DevDay looked to the future, I was especially curious about what OpenAI COO Brad Lightcap had to say about the past.

item.title: How REI’s store closings in New York and Boston could derail the CEO’s efforts to win over employees
item.description: The CEO told staff that the co-op had to make some "tough choices" to fix the business.

item.title: I’m the founder of a $1 billion travel unicorn. Here’s what growing up in hotel lobbies taught me about leadership
item.description: I see companies less like machines and more like living organisms. Like an amoeba, you need to be semi-permeable.

item.title: Is it okay to hug coworkers?

item.title: Microsoft Office’s icons just got curvy, colorful upgrades

item.title: It’s Unusual for Gold and Stocks to Boom at the Same Time
item.description: Gold and stocks typically alternate years of strength and weakness.

item.title: Trump, Xi maneuver for leverage as talks, truce expiry loom
item.description: China this week unveiled new curbs on its rare earth exports, echoing moves made in April in response to Trump’s “Liberation Day” tariffs.

item.title: Global selloff underway as traders sour on U.S. government shutdown and doubts about the Fed grow
item.description: It’s not chaos but it’s not good.
